title: Stop rewarding damage with durability
body:
https://i.gyazo.com/bb912ec0aae58f5f45fd20889b6745ce.png

this is ridiculous, lifesteal monsters are already a massive nuisance and you're going to let them overheal on a mastery, which will stack even higher with {{item:3072}} ?

the counterplay to these tumors is to be able to burst them so their massive draintanking doesn't come into effect, so why are you giving them a shield to mitigate that burst? Don't do this, Riot, lifesteal is already a big enough problem right now 

DD buffs have me worried Illaoi is going to be nerfed soon; this overhealing mechanic will guarantee her needing one

source http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/game-updates/features/coming-preseason-runes-reforged

replies.body:
Also, essence theif: everyone gets a weaker but equally relevant Sion W passive. 

...WTF?

Just means Sion gets _two_ Sion passives 

{{sticker:slayer-jinx-wink}}

Sion already gets two Sion passives.

One of them is health-stacking and the other turns him into an inferior Tibbers.

That's not funny. Sion has a low health pool because of his passive. Other tanks don't and would end up benefiting from this at a much better rate. 

I mean, it's great for support tanks that can't CS cause of the ADC. But it COMPLETELY shits on the reasons Sion has low HP early and makes him a lot less unique.
Could result in a buff on his passive, giving him more health per minion death or something.

His point still stands. In case Sion also takes the Rune, he still benefits more. Yes, the enemy tank stacks HP and has higher base HP but you cannot deny Sion, with the same AND bonus source of HP stacking is not going to over-effect them. He gains around 3 HP per kill and let's say 2 HP from two extra deaths around while the enemy gets just 3 HP even If they kill the units, not to mentoin Sion gets now and then whole 10 HP.

In other words Sion with good farming gets around 25 HP where enemy gets 6 HP.
Is that an upcoming rune?

Riot seems to forget that a champion with {{item:3812}} {{item:3072}} {{item:3153}} can be just as tanky as a actual tank champion. Tired of seeing this disgusting {{item:3812}} {{item:3047}} Draven build which abuses this feature.

Honestly this doesnt even seem that good. When you compare it to something like the current Vampirism + life steal quints, it seems pretty sub par. You have to factor in that this system is replacing both masteries and runes. Unless the healing pushes you over 100% HP, it completely useless. Contrast it to Vampirism and some life steal runes which are effective at any HP %.

still it prevents Burst and that's what it is made for.

maybe the 10% will actually safe you and you would be dead without it before you could even lifesteal back.
Still though it doesnt offer any additional sustain. The specific complaint about it is "draintanking" which this would actually reduce when compared to current runes and masteries

combine that with {{item:3072}} and say that again.

especially {{champion:119}} will be full cancer.

Nobody even builds BT anymore because it turns out the shield is practically meaningless on the squishies that build it. A shield with no resistances to back it up isnt worth much.

Thats why people build {{item:3153}} or {{item:3812}} over {{item:3072}} for their lifesteal currently
with such a Rune it will probably come back.
and? thats the point of an evolving shifting game, you make changes, these changes shift gameplay, adjustments are made, the game changes, repeat indefinitely.
when evolving means that this shitty shield spam will be even worse than it is now already then i'm out

fair enough, but you dont get a shield to spam with this. you only heal if you were already AT 100% and last i checked you can't kill anyone at 100% health without dropping them to 0% health, in which case this rune is then useless until use of items and other forms of sustain to get whoever has it BACK to 100%

I agree that too many shieldy spammy battle lengthening is quite annoying, i've even made a specific team comp to abuse that, but this rune is not it.
Eh. Its still super expensive. I don't think it will come back without a price adjustment. There's just no reason to get it over DD or Bork. The shield isn't worth that much.

my complaint is that in addition to someone like Fiora who already draintanks you with {{item:3074}} {{item:3812}} +her innate sustain from passive/ult, will ALSO be able to overheal, which means if the shield is significant enough to matter then she'll be even harder for a lot of champions to deal with since that shield means you need that much more burst to kill her through it. 

it's just extraneous, in my opinion

{{champion:114}} : {{item:3074}}{{item:3071}} {{item:3812}} + new Keystone

Imagine her split-pushing and going to try and stop her, only now she's got a perma-shield to mitigate any initial burst because she keeps constantly over-healed from Lifestealing off of the minion waves.

Extra health + percent damage reduction (as a bleed out) + 2 sources of healing off her damage, one of which is AoE + a shield that scales with Cleaver's health and any other defense items with health she buys after this

Yep, that won't be obnoxious ever.

Prepare for another {{champion:157}} permaban.
Oh wait.
He is always permabanned.

prepare for {{champion:119}} {{champion:114}} {{champion:82}} {{champion:420}}  permabans too

zz i don't want my champion to get made broken
Fiora is already permaban lul

> DD buffs have me worried Illaoi is going to be nerfed soon; this overhealing mechanic will guarantee her needing one

In case you've forgotten, Illaoi's tentacles heal her for 5% missing health. In order to get the Overheal shield, you need 100% HP, **aka no missing health.** This means that your tentacles won't overheal you _unless you have DD._ I know from experience that Illaoi needs to win lane most of the time in order to afford items, which means that Overheal will only be effective on her if _and only if_ she's ahead.

She'll be fine, I guarantee it.

>unless you have DD.

good thing I mentioned DD when I was talking about Illaoi, huh

You missed the point, so let me make it more clear:

She needs DD to overheal.
Therefore, she will not overheal until second or third item.
By second or third item, her effectiveness in the game will have already been decided (most of the time).
This means that overheal will not break her.

DD is first item post-cleaver nerf except vs tanks who are rushing and stacking armor

and when she buys the item doesn't really matter; broken is broken and I like my champion balanced as she is right now

DD first item? A fully offensive build path (Pickaxe + Caulfield's + Vamp scepter) and 3500g cost? Damn, that's ballsy; I have to disagree with that decision. Illaoi as a juggernaut already has problems with cc, as she can't heal while cc'ed, and making her build a fully AD item first will expose that weakness even more. She needs some unconditional defense in her first item, whether health or resist, in order to help her with that weakness.

Also her base damage is insane, and BC magnifies that by a lot, even after nerfs. You don't need a lot of AD to do damage.

as a plat 2 illaoi main, and I know a couple much higher rank Illaoi mains will swear by DD rush, I feel comfortable telling you that it's her best first item vs the majority of top lane match ups. her base damage is pretty ass; Illaoi runs off of AD ratios and the added sustain + 80 AD + the DD damage-to-dot makes her extremely powerful and hard for most duelists to fight

the only time I deviate is vs tanks who stack armor and also do a lot of damage while going tank, and vs hard lanes like Swain or Teemo where I'll take a hybrid item like hexdrinker first because of ranged harass and dots

But this illaoi we're taking about. Illaoi, that shit champion.

Overheal certainly isn't putting her over the edge. Other champions yes, but not her.
illaoi is already very strong from DD buffs

https://na.op.gg/champion/illaoi/statistics/top

Uhhhhhhhh? What?

> why give them a shield to mitigate burst thats supposed to counter them



{{champion:157}} 
hehe xd


Doesnt seem too bad to me tbh, other.. runes or whatever theyre called are probably gonna be as strong or even stronger.

this isn't even a keystone rune though, lul

so on top of this they could get that "berserk" keystone with the shitload of extra atk speed that ignores the cap

Uh, an extra 10% health is not going to save most carries from your average assassin.  Even with 30% from Overheal and Bloodthirster, I have more than enough damage as, say, Talon or Ekko to kill any carry without a defensive steroid.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Q7wGp9d8KEU&t=0s Look at #4 at 2:38. Doesn't have to save them from an assassin. In the video the Twitch practically heals to full health again from the lifesteal, allowing him to further increase that health pool is retarded. This gives the already insanely powerful ADCs right now another edge on enemies.
Just make it not apply to lifesteal. Make it only work on ability and active item healing

I like the idea of overhealing.  It makes it anti-burst and slightly anti-poke, but does not really affect extended fights between dps champs.  What I don't like is an adc getting 40% lifesteal on top of 2000 dps and Lulu's everything.
The counter to ADCs are assassins and burst mages and you think it's a good idea to remove that weakness?

It doesn't remove a weakness, it alters it.  In order to actually make use of that shield, their support will either be going oom overhealing them, they will be pushing hard by constantly attacking, or they are stacking lifesteal anyway, in which case they have Bloodthirster already.  The issue is not that a ~200 health shield is making it so that burst champs have to deal with their draintanking, their issue is draintanking in the first place, which is bad design for a squishy and should be reserved for juggernauts and a few health-based champs.
I think he means that it's a good idea to give them tools to mitigate their weakness, but only if these tools do not stack to the point that said weakness is cancelled for almost no cost.

Not really, it only kicks in if you're already full health, otherwise you're relying on the lifesteal already in game, and you're losing a bucnh f the masteries that helped lifesteal spike at all.

Like all it does is add more HP to break through if anything, which sucks but oh well?
The plans for these runes aren't concrete lifesteal might not even proc the overheal shield and only heals like nami/sona w will

Depends on how they define healing.

If it's only heal spells, like Sona and Soraka, it will be balanced.

If it involves regeneration or lifesteal effects, it's gonna be problematic.

I have been complained about "Lifesteal" for years; is the most unbalanced stat in the game. 

Meanwhile, "spellvamp" was removed from ítems because "it could be broken in Vladimir and Fiddlesticks". Apparently the possibility of 2 out of 140 champions been broken is a good reason to remove a stat from the game completely. Go figure.

> Essence Thief
> Gain 1 permanent max health when enemy minions die near you. Range: 1400 units 

im absolutely in love with this rune. however please make sure that adc and assassins dont get their hands on this either.

it depends how the new mastery/rune system is going to work.

certain runes like the overheal rune might be linked to a specific mastery tree. meddler said at one point, that their goal is set at 5 mastery trees overall.

if the overheal rune is gated behind a mastery tree for fighters or tanks, it wouldnt be very accessable to carries, and more used by tanks and juggs like in cases of {{item:3083}} regeneration to build up a shield while out of combat, or general fighter sustain like {{champion:266}} . these champions are already balanced around being burst resistant, and it would only equate to a bit more health on them.


i absolutely agree that the anti-burst mechanics for adc are already excessive and they should definitely not have access to this. item passives like {{item:3046}} {{item:3026}} {{item:3072}} {{item:3812}} shouldnt be available to them on major offensive items like they are.

theyre paying shit for the extra protection. being burst resistant as a marksman used to be a tradeoff. now its just tacked onto their core damage items.
So stop asking for an AP scaling on Galio's W.

durability scaling with durability is fucking stupid, too

just a band-aid after riot went and  fucked up all the tank items so they needed to be _conditionally_ tanky
So offensive that scales with offense is also dumb?
